Free_Value_Prop: Free AI Act calculator, compliance checklists
Why_This_Score: Regulatory tsunami incoming. High-ticket B2B, sticky once embedded (switching = re-audit). Main risk: Big 4 consultancies wake up.
Strong unit economics at $20k+ deals. But saturated market, constant Bubble/Retool competition, 6-month sales cycles typical.
Proven model (Tiny/FE International), but requires $500k+ capital, deep technical expertise. Not really "99% free" model.
Good margins but brutal competition (Apollo, ZoomInfo, Clay). Need $2M+ to build competitive dataset.
Solves real pain, but hard to scale quality. Marketplace dynamics = race to bottom on price.
Duolingo has $1-2 CAC, 33x LTV. You have $50+ CAC, maybe 3x LTV. They have $300M AI budget. You don't.
Slightly better unit economics via bundling, but still competing with free Duolingo. EdTech retention = 2-30%. Nightmare.
TPT has 5M teachers, you're starting at zero. Teachers share everything in Facebook groups. Copyright nightmare.
Thingiverse = infinite free files. Creators earn 15-30% on paid platforms. Race to bottom, impossible differentiation.
High margins theoretically, but platforms will ban AI content instantly once detected. Legal/ethical minefield.
2% day-30 retention in EdTech. Parents buy, kids don't use. Massive creative production costs for quality games.
Publishers own all valuable IP. Copyright hell. Parents use library or pirate. $10B market but Big 5 own 80%.
Khan Academy is free and better. IXL/Prodigy have school contracts locked. Individual parent CAC = $150+.
Zero moat. ChatGPT generates infinite stories free. No network effects, pure commodity.
Spotify devalued ambient to 1/5th royalties. YouTube has infinite free options. Maybe 10k commercial buyers globally.
Redbubble takes 20%, Printful has no fees, Canva is free. POD margins already razor-thin. This adds zero value.
